name: PHATurator
headline:
Colour Your Sound

Make tracks feel expensive in 10 seconds. Bigger, louder, richer saturation you can track through.
discountText: Reduced price only applies to Founders' Month, until 1st March 2026

items.title: Why stack saturations?
items.text:
Because great tone is built in stages. In a real studio, sound is shaped by multiple pieces of gear, each adding a small amount of colour and harmonic detail. Stacking saturations lets you work the same way in the box. Instead of pushing one stage too hard, you spread the work across several, keeping the result controlled, musical, and natural.

This is how your favourite records were made. Now it's just one click away.

items.title: Six styles of timeless saturations.
items.text:
The modelling goes beyond surface tone to real analogue behaviour.

From the snappy punch of British consoles to the creamy warmth of 70s preamps and vintage tape glue, these six algorithms deliver the feel and response of the hardware. They breathe, break up, and react to your dynamics with the same musicality and emotion as the original units.

items.title:
Zero Latency.
Featherlight.
No iLok.
items.text:
We've removed the friction of legacy software: no dongles, no internet requirements, no barriers to your workflow. Engineered for maximum speed and efficiency, our plugins are light enough for huge sessions, and fast enough for real-time tracking.

It's just you and your sound, exactly as it should be.

audio.title: Experience The Difference
audio.subheader: What can PHATurator do for your sound? Listen to it for yourself.

testimonials.quote: I think PHATurator is gonna be one of those level game changers for a lot of people. I literally can't work without it now! I use it on pretty much every track - I think it creates so much more depth and definition between instruments and being able to dial in different flavours at the same time is so useful.
testimonials.author: Bob Cooper
testimonials.bands: Nai Harvest, Self Defense Family, Rob Lynch

testimonials.quote: I really like the PHATurator. Used it on a bass that had been sent for mixing, it was too spiky sounding so I stacked up bits of distortion to soften the transient and then used the filter to round it off. Ended up with a really fat, round bass sound.
testimonials.author: Jim Pinder
testimonials.bands: Sleep Token, Bring Me The Horizon, Bullet For My Valentine

testimonials.quote: It looks fantastic and is really easy to navigate. The layout is really intuitive so the learning curve was very minimal. I really enjoyed that the finer details were more tucked away so you have the option of getting more nerdy if you want to but the initial instance is quite simple.
testimonials.author: Sam Bloor

items.title: Dynamic guitars
items.text: Put your guitars back in the spotlight. Whether you're needing to add life, energy, or character, PHATurator offers the spark you're looking for.

items.title: Thicker, punchier drums
items.text: Adds weight and analogue density, with no digital harshness.

items.title: All your saturation needs in one plug-in
items.text: From injecting a sprinkle of energy to a lifeless source with subtle studio-grade saturation, to warping its character into something entirely new, the flexibility within PHATurator's Clean, PHAT & PHATTER modes can take you from 0 to 90% in a couple of clicks.

items.title: Big basses
items.text: No more small, sterile lows. Give your mix a solid anchor with in-depth, finely tuned low-end control.

items.title: Own your loops
items.text: Whether they're vibey or hard hitting, stamp your personality on your loops with PHATurator's endless unique possibilities and combinations. Your own style is just a twist of a knob away.

items.title: Lush vocals
items.text: Push your vocals forward in the mix, giving them presence and naturally smoothing any transients or spikeness.

items.title: Zero latency.
items.text: Track through it. Mix with it. Perform live with it. No lag, no compromise.

items.title: Big sound, small footprint.
items.text: PHATurator is efficient by design: high impact but low overhead. Big sessions stay fast and smooth, so you can finally bid those 'System Overload' playback errors farewell.

items.title: Offline-ready licensing.
items.text: Install. Authorise offline. Done. Keep working with no interruption, no gimmicks and no internet checks. Once it's yours, it's yours.

items.title: Don't take our word for it. Try it now.
items.text: Full features are available in Trial Mode (with infrequent silences), so you can decide with confidence before you buy.

items.title: Shortcuts? Finally.
items.text: Put your mouse on notice and keep your hands where it matters, on the keys. Full shortcut support, so your workflow doesn't lose its flow.

items.title: Phat / Phatter / Clean.
items.text: Three distinct attitudes in one switch. Keep it transparent with CLEAN, engage PHAT for subtle transformer saturation and low-end warmth, or go all-out with PHATTER for dual-transformer drive and aggressive resonance.

items.a: PHATurator is an analogue-modeled multi-stage saturation plugin. Unlike standard saturators that offer just one flavour, PHATurator lets you stack and blend six distinct analogue circuits - from Tube and Tape to FET and Class A Preamp styles - to colour your sound with rich harmonics, depth, and controlled grit. It also features a global Mix knob for instant parallel processing.

PHATurator includes six distinct saturation algorithms:
  • FET: Detector-driven dynamics (76-style feel) for punch and control.
  • TUBE: Classic tube saturation to make sources fuller and harmonically rich.
  • TAPE: Vintage glue, tasty saturation, and subtle stereo width.
  • PUNCH: Large-format British console saturation with tight low end, snappy transients, and assertive upper mids.
  • PHAT: Fuller low-mid punch with pleasing compression-like behaviour. Very loudness-friendly.
  • WARMTH: Thick, transformer-rich 70s British Class A preamp vibe with creamy low mids.

items.q: What formats does it come in and what DAW does it work with?
items.a: We provide VST3, Audio Unit, and AAX formats for MacOS, VST3 and AAX for Windows. Any DAW that supports these format will work with them, for example: Logic Pro, Pro Tools, Ableton Live, Cubase, Studio One, FL Studio, Reaper.

items.q: Does it work on Apple Silicon (M1 to M5) Macs? What about old Intel Macs?
items.a: PHATurator is fully native for Apple Silicon chips (M1, M2, M3 etc) as well as Intel Macs. No Rosetta required, but it's also compatible with Rosetta.

Mac: macOS 10.13 or higher (Intel or Apple Silicon).
Windows: Windows 10 or 11 (64-bit).
General: 2GB RAM required, 30MB free disk space.

items.q: How many computers can I install it on?
items.a: Each license includes up to three simultaneous activations per user. This could be your main studio machine, a laptop, and a third rig. We understand that modern production often means working across multiple machines, so we're doing our bit to have your tools available wherever you need them.

items.q: Can I try it before purchasing it?
items.a: Yes, you can download a trial from our Downloads page. The trial version has all features of the full version, but inserts a short infrequent silence so you can decide with confidence before you buy.

items.q: Do I need to pay for updates?
items.a: NEVER. We believe in perpetual license and we like to work uninterrupted. So as long as fedDSP will be a company, your perpetual license will receive unlimited free updates.

items.q: Where can I find the manual?
items.a: You can read the full User Manual here.
